title: (With two photos) Two suspects in custody for murder of 11-year-old El Dorado youth
content:
Two men have been charged with capital murder in connection with a shooting Thursday night in El Dorado, which resulted in the death of an 11-year-old boy.
Shaquille Green, 20, was taken into custody on Friday afternoon, El Dorado police said.
Arrested earlier was Patrick L. Rogers, 24. In addition to capital murder, Rogers is charged with terroristic act, aggravated assault, possession of a firearm by certain persons, enhanced penalty for commission of an offense in front of a child, and engaging in a continuing criminal enterprise.
The name of the victim has not been released.
El Dorado police said the victim was shot about 7 p.m. in a home at the intersection of Louisiana Avenue and East Cook Street in southeast El Dorado. He was reported to have been struck by a stray bullet.
